com.snakybo.torch.graphics.monitor

Class DisplayMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snakybo.torch.graphics.monitor.DisplayMode

  • public class DisplayMode
extends java.lang.Object

    A DisplayMode is a container class with all the information to create a window.

    A DisplayMode can be created manually using one of the constructors, but there is no guarantee the user's system has support for it.

    You can also get all available display modes for a monitor using Monitor.getAllDisplayModes(), or just the native display mode using Monitor.getNativeDisplayMode().

    Since:
    1.0

      • getBitsPerPixel

        public final int getBitsPerPixel()

        Get the number of bits per pixel.

        Bits per pixel is not stored as a separate value for the R, G, B, and A channels. This value is used for all 4.

        Returns:
        The number of bits per pixel.
